us-bibliographic-data-grant.invention-title: Totem controller having an illumination region

nplcit.othercit: Samsung ET-YO324BBEGUS Gear VR Controller, posted Apr. 21, 2017 [online], [retrieved Jan. 9, 2023]. Retrieved from internet, https://www.amazon.com/Samsung-ET-Y0324BBEGUS-Gear-VR-Controller/dp/B06XHXRXP1 (Year: 2017).

description-of-drawings.p: The patent or application file contains at least one drawing executed in color. Copies of this patent or patent application publication with color drawing(s) will be provided by the Office upon request and payment of the necessary fee.
FIG. 1 is a top view of a totem controller having an illumination region showing a image in a sequence for the illumination region of our design;
FIG. 2 is a top view showing a second image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 3 is a top view showing a third image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 4 is a top view showing a fourth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 5 is a top view showing a fifth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 6 is a top view showing a sixth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 7 is a top view showing a seventh image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 8 is a top view showing an eighth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 9 is a top view showing a ninth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 10 is a top view showing a tenth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 11 is a top view showing an eleventh image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 12 is a top view showing a twelfth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 13 is a top view showing a thirteenth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 14 is a top view showing a fourteenth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 15 is a front perspective view of a totem controller having an illumination region showing a first image in the sequence for the illumination region of our design;
FIG. 16 is a front perspective view showing a second image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 17 is a front perspective view showing a third image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 18 is a front perspective view showing a fourth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 19 is a front perspective view showing a fifth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 20 is a front perspective view showing a sixth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 21 is a front perspective view showing a seventh image in first sequence thereof;
FIG. 22 is a front perspective view showing an eighth image in first sequence thereof;
FIG. 23 is a front perspective view showing a ninth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 24 is a front perspective view showing a tenth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 25 is a front perspective view showing an eleventh image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 26 is a front perspective view showing a twelfth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 27 is a front perspective view showing a thirteenth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 28 is a front perspective view showing a fourteenth image in the sequence thereof;
FIG. 29 is a bottom view of a totem controller having an illumination region of FIGS. 1-28;
FIG. 30 is a left side view thereof;
FIG. 31 is a right side view thereof;
FIG. 32 is a rear view thereof;
FIG. 33 is a front view thereof;
FIG. 34 is a top view of thereof showing our design in a non-illuminated state; and,
FIG. 35 is a front perspective view thereof showing our design in a non-illuminated state.

The broken lines in FIGS. 1-35 depicting various optional components of a totem controller are included for illustrating environmental structure and form no part of the claimed design. The long-short dashed lines in FIGS. 1-28 indicate curvature and form no part of the claimed design.

The appearance of the illumination region sequentially transitions between the images shown for the sequence in FIGS. 1-28. The process or period in which one image transitions to another in the sequence forms no part of the claimed design.
The difference in color in the sequence indicates a contrast in the colored illumination of the sequence and does not depict any particular texture or material.

Applicant recognizes inventive aspects of the totem controller having an illumination region, and portions thereof, with the illumination region illuminated in any of the single state illumination patterns shown in individual images, or in any combination of some or all of the single state illumination patterns shown, or in the entireties of the sequence of illumination shown herein.

claim.claim-text: The ornamental design for a totem controller having an illumination region, as shown and described.
